Talk_0037:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>Oh! Thank you! Not being able to open
that door was really starting to annoy me.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>So a cutout was blocking the door?
Well, I appreciate your help, whoever
you are!
I'm really sorry, but I'm a bit too busy
right now to reward you though...
Talk_0008:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Ah, sorry.<sp:5:0:0> I was distracted.


I was just thinking about what I should
give my <clr:0000>daughter<clr:ffff> before her big move.

She's been doing so much, between
making friends with the villagers here
and studying in her <clr:0000>room<clr:ffff>.
I want to support her however I can.
Talk_0038:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Chat>Unbelievable. <sp:5:0:0>I'll have to swap it out
for a new one...
Talk_0009:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>I'm sure she's already gone to bed by
now though...
Talk_0039: <sp:3:0:2:0000>All right... That should take care of that.
Talk_0010:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_00>Once she's off on her journey, I think
I'll start <clr:0000>accepting dream-home
requests <clr:ffff>again.
I'm sorry, but I hope you can wait
until then.
Talk_0040:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Angry_00>The construction company is making use
of that cutout right now. Show it a little
respect, OK?
Talk_0041:
<sp:3:0:2:0901><snd:Angry_00>I don't really want to repeat myself, but
it seems necessary—we're using that
cutout, so could you please respect that?
Talk_0014:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Oh, sorry... My daughter is studying in
her room, and I want to finish packing
for her while I can...
Once she's off on her journey, I think
I'll start <clr:0000>accepting dream-home
requests <clr:ffff>again.
I hope you can wait until then.
Talk_1001:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Sad_01>Heh.<sp:5:1:0> It's fine to walk around like that
here, but if we were in Gerudo Town, that
wouldn't work out for you at all.
Talk_0015:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy>If it's not too much trouble for you, I'm
sure it'd make my daughter happy for you
to go along with her games.
Talk_0016:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_00>After she saw how hard her dad was
working, she decided to start working
hard herself too.
<sp:3:0:2:0001>But...don't tell him that story—it would
probably go to his head, hehe.

<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Anyway, once she's off on her journey,
I think I'll start <clr:0000>accepting dream-home
requests <clr:ffff>again.
Sorry for the trouble, but check back with
me later, all right?
Talk_0017:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Did my daughter convince you to take
<clr:0000>lessons <clr:ffff>from her?<sp:0:4:0>It's a game she came up with to get
others to learn along with her.

If it's not too much trouble for you, I'm
sure it'd make her happy for you to go
along with it.
<clr:0200><sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy_00>She used to burst into tears whenever she had
trouble with a lesson. I remember her trying to say
the "v" in "sav'otta"...<sp:0:2:2:6400><clr:ffff>

Talk_0027:

Your dream-home adventure is just

Talk_0028:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>They're a bit banged up, so I was planning

to them too.
Talk_0001:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>That's the company's storehouse.


However, the door seems to be stuck and
can't be opened from the <clr:0000>outside<clr:ffff>.
Maybe something is <clr:0000>blocking it inside<clr:ffff>?
Talk_0030:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Even my daughter Mattison has talked
about wanting a dream home of her
own, and...
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I'm sorry.


Whenever I let my mind wander, I start
thinking about Mattison again.

<sp:3:0:2:0300>To Gerudo, it is a wonderful thing when
we return to Gerudo Town.

And it is now too. <sp:5:0:0>Really!<sp:5:0:0> But...


<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I just worry about her. <sp:5:0:0>I hope that she'll
be OK on her own and that she's
doing well.
Talk_0002:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>Oh! Thank you! Not being able to open
that door was really starting to annoy me.

So a cutout was blocking the door?
Well, I appreciate your help getting it out
of the way!
Talk_0031:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Mattison talked a lot about wanting
to build a sun-colored dream home
next, and...
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I'm sorry.


Whenever I let my mind wander, I start
thinking about Mattison again.

<sp:3:0:2:0300>I put on a strong front when I was talking
to Hudson, but I might be the one feeling
her absence the most.
Talk_0003:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Sorry, but the construction company is
still using that cutout.
Talk_0004:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>The Gerudo region doesn't get rain, so
she won't need any of her rain gear...

It's hot during the day, of course, but
the nights get cold. I should pack some
warm things...
Talk_0033:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Ease_01>Oh, what am I even worrying about. That
girl is stronger than anyone I know.

<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_01>She's Hudson's and my vai, after all!


Ha, I'm sure Mattison would laugh at me
for worrying so much about her too.

<sp:3:0:2:0100>OK, I think I can really focus on my
work now.

Sarqso for showing me that picture of my
precious daughter.
Talk_0005:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_00>I thought I heard your voice coming from
upstairs. Sarqso for being so concerned
about my daughter.
Did she convince you to take <clr:0000>lessons<clr:ffff> too?<sp:0:4:0>It's a game she came up with to get
others to learn along with her.

If it's not too much trouble for you, I'm
sure it'd make her happy for you to go
along with it.
<clr:0200><sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0100>She used to burst into tears whenever she had
trouble with a lesson. I remember her trying to say
the "v" in "sav'otta"...<sp:0:2:2:6400><clr:ffff>

I think I'll start <clr:0000>accepting dream-home
requests <clr:ffff>again.
Sorry for the trouble, but check back with
me later, all right?
Talk_0034:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:TalkPositive_00>All of my worries and fears for Mattison
have been swept away thanks to you
showing me that picture of her.
I feel like I can focus on my work now.
Truly, sarqso.
Talk_0006:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think_01>It sounds like my husband is really busy
at the construction site. He won't be able
to leave for a while...
Not too long ago, he had to work late
several days in a row, and Mattison got
really upset about it.
Finally, I decided to take her to the
construction site using the <clr:0000>railcar<clr:ffff>...

She'd been so upset until that point, but
when she saw her father working hard,
she said...
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy_00>"Papa has such dedicat-son! I should
be more like him, so I'll stop crying and
be more patient!"
That was the moment, I think. <sp:5:1:0>She saw
how hard her dad was working and
decided to start working hard herself too.
<sp:3:0:2:0100>But...don't tell him that story—it would
probably go to his head, hehe.
Talk_0035:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Think_00>Now that we're apart, I just can't seem
to relax...
Talk_0007:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>I've been told that someone from
Gerudo Town will come to pick up my
daughter soon. Time really does fly...
Once that's happened and she's off on
her journey, I think I'll start <clr:0000>accepting
dream-home requests <clr:ffff>again.
Sorry for the trouble, but check in with
me again soon, OK?

<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Sad>...I am a little worried for Hudson though. I'm not
sure he's ready for his little girl to move away.<sp:0:2:2:6400>
